sections.name: Spinel Leviathan Syndara
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

link.name: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 58
link.alt: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 58

link.name: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 58
link.alt: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 58

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Lawful
traits.text: Lawful effects often manipulate energy from law-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to chaotic divine servants or divine servants of chaotic deities. A creature with this trait is lawful in alignment.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Gargantuan
traits.text: *Space:* 20 feet or more, *Reach (Tall):* 20 feet, *Reach (Long):* 15 feet

traits.name: Aeon
traits.text: These monitors are the self-styled defenders of reality. Traditional aeons have dualistic natures and forms, and they hold a dichotomy of interests, though axiomites and inevitables do not. Aeons other than axiomites and inevitables communicate via a strange telepathic hodgepodge of sensory sending called envisioning.

traits.name: Monitor
traits.text: Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the neutrally aligned planes are called monitors. Monitors can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere.

link.name: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 58
link.alt: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 58

interaction_abilities.name: Spatial Sense
interaction_abilities.text: Syndara instinctively knows the position of all creatures and objects within the Glass Lighthouse as a precise sense. His senses do not extend into extraplanar spaces such as a bag of holding), even if the entrance to these spaces is within the Lighthouse.

modifiers.name: +1 status to all saves vs. magical
+4 status to all saves vs. mental

automatic_abilities.name: Center of the World
automatic_abilities.trigger: A creature finishes moving, even if it moved using something other than a move action
automatic_abilities.effect: Syndara is the figurative and literal center of this world. As the triggering creature moves, space reasserts itself, teleporting Syndara to be in the same position relative to the creature as he was when the creature began its movement. If the space he would teleport into is occupied, he displaces the obstructing creature or object into the nearest available space.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Teleportation
traits.text: Teleportation effects allow you to instantaneously move from one point in space to another. Teleportation does not usually trigger reactions based on movement.

automatic_abilities.name: Extradimensional Immunity
automatic_abilities.text: ; Syndara can foil any attempts to use planar powers against him. He is immune to all extradimensional effects, such as maze, but can choose to be affected by such effects normally.

automatic_abilities.name: Keeper of the Lighthouse
automatic_abilities.text: ; Syndara can choose whether he is affected by his worldspheres (page 57).

automatic_abilities.name: Portal Redirection
automatic_abilities.trigger: Syndara is targeted by a ranged Strike or spell attack roll
automatic_abilities.effect: Syndara opens a portal in front of the incoming missile, then opens another portal nearby that fires the missile at another creature within 60 feet of him. He takes no damage from the triggering attack and makes a ranged Strike with a +43 attack bonus. The Strike deals damage according to the triggering ability.

traits.name: Conjuration
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the conjuration school of magic, typically involving summoning, creation, teleportation, or moving things from place to place.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Teleportation
traits.text: Teleportation effects allow you to instantaneously move from one point in space to another. Teleportation does not usually trigger reactions based on movement.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

traits.name: Versatile
traits.text: A versatile weapon can be used to deal a different type of damage than that listed in the Damage entry. This trait indicates the alternate damage type. For instance, a piercing weapon that is versatile S can be used to deal piercing or slashing damage. You choose the damage type each time you make an attack.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Brutal
traits.text: A ranged attack with this trait uses its Strength modifier instead of Dexterity on the attack roll.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Propulsive
traits.text: You add half your Strength modifier (if positive) to damage rolls with a propulsive ranged weapon. If you have a negative Strength modifier, you add your full Strength modifier instead.

traits.name: Splash
traits.text: When you use a thrown weapon with the splash trait, you don’t add your Strength modifier to the damage roll. If an attack with a splash weapon fails, succeeds, or critically succeeds, all creatures within 5 feet of the target (including the target) take the listed splash damage. On a failure (but not a critical failure), the target of the attack still takes the splash damage. Add splash damage together with the initial damage against the target before applying the target’s weaknesses or resistances. You don’t multiply splash damage on a critical hit.

traits.name: Range
traits.text: These attacks will either list a finite range or a range increment, which follows the normal rules for range increments.

ability.name: Dimensional Flurry
ability.text: Syndara makes six Strikes. Any creature struck must succeed at a DC 46 Will save or be teleported to a location of Syndara's choice within 60 feet of him when the flurry is complete. The teleportation has the conjuration, divine, and teleportation traits.

ability.name: Dimensional Grasp

traits.name: Abjuration
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the abjuration school of magic, typically involving protection or wards.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

ability.text: Syndara's grasp extends across dimensions. Creatures grabbed by Syndara can't benefit from teleportation, extradimensional effects, or effects that would move them to a different plane.

ability.name: Mover of Worlds

traits.name: Conjuration
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the conjuration school of magic, typically involving summoning, creation, teleportation, or moving things from place to place.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

ability.text: With great regret, Syndara calls his masterpieces from the firmament to crash down upon his enemies. He flings four worldspheres to any four points within 500 feet. Each worldsphere deals 20d6 damage in a 40-foot burst (DC 48 basic Reflex save). Syndara chooses the type of damage for each worldsphere, which can be any type he chooses, though each worldsphere must deal a different type of damage. On a failed save, the target is pushed to the edge of the burst. No matter how many overlapping explosions it's caught in, a creature can take damage from only one worldsphere per round. Syndara is immune to the damage dealt by his worldspheres. Syndara can't use Mover of Worlds again for 1d4 rounds.
